Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for the 2018 Parallel Architectures and Compilation Techniques (PACT-18) Conference

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
The 27th International Conference on Parallel Architectures and Compilation Techniques is the premier forum for presenting, discussing, and debating innovative compiler and architectural techniques for advanced computing and communication systems. This conference brings together researchers in fields related to architecture, compiler, application, language and systems for technical exchange on traditional system topics and emerging research areas. The PACT community has enjoyed a close interaction between academic researchers and industrial designers and aims to continue this tradition at PACT 2018. This project funds student travel grant, and includes a goal to broaden and diversify the student participation in the 27th International Conference on Parallel Architecture and Compilation Techniques (PACT 2018). This year's conference, being in its 27th year, will be held from November 1-4, 2018 in Limassol, Cyprus.

This proposal has two primary Broader Impacts. First, the students receiving travel support will benefit from the opportunity to engage in the technical, professional, educational and social exchanges that PACT fosters. The conference serves as an open forum to exchange research results and develop new ideas, as an educational platform to expose students to new research methodologies, tools, and infrastructures, and as a social event to network and prepare students as future researchers. Second, the PACT conference will be indirectly strengthened. More tutorials and workshops can be associated with the main conference, as a result of increased number of student attendance that this travel grant will enable. More broadly, this travel support will increase the attendance of under-represented minorities and talented undergraduate students, attracting them to graduate schools.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Parallel Architectures and Compilation Techniques (PACT) conference is a premier forum for presenting, discussing and debating new and innovative ideas at the intersection of parallel computer architecture and compilers. This symposium brings together researchers in fields related to processor architecture, compilers, chips, and systems.

The purpose of this grant was to support student travel to attend PACT 2018 held in Limassol, Cyprus.

Such travel enriches the conference, exposes students to the latest scientific findings in the field, and helps educate the next generation of scholars and practitioners in the field. It also provides support for underrepresented groups to attend the conference.

Seventeen students from around the world applied for a student travel grant to PACT. The total sponsorship totaled $28,000 with $15,000 coming from the National Science Foundation. All eligible students were provided some support to attend the conference. 

The award from the National Science Foundation supported the partial travel costs of 8 students studying in US universities. The average award amount provided per student with NSF funding was $1875 to enable them to defray some of the registration, flight and hotel costs for the trip to Cyprus.

The US students supported by this grant will likely seek employment at US corporations, universities, and government research labs. Hence, the travel awards made possible by this grant helps contribute to the creation and retention of a highly trained, diverse, and capable IT workforce which is critical for continued economic growth.

 


Last Modified: 08/14/2019
Modified by: Tushar Krishna
